comments:
Windows XP. I extracted the Eclipse 3.2 into the directory where the 3.1.2 installation was residing. After starting the Eclipse afterwards, I can't save any modified file in editor. I get a message mox saying

Save Failed:org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.HistoryStore2.<init>(Lorg/eclipse/core/internal/resources/Workspace;Lorg/eclipse/core/runtime/IPath;I)V

As I have found nobody else reporting this bug I assume it must be somehow related to the way I upgraded the Eclipse.

The Eclipse log contains the following stack trace:

It seems to me that you have installed 3.2 over 3.1.2 which is not a supported scenario. If not, could you please provide us with the workspace?

(In reply to comment #1)
> It seems to me that you have installed 3.2 over 3.1.2 which is not a supported
> scenario. If not, could you please provide us with the workspace?
> 

Yes, that is what I did. I wonder why this isn't a supported scenario. Do I have to install all of my Eclipse plugins again each time a new version of Eclipse is released?

It is not supported because depending old version might be picked instead of new ones causing unexpected errors like the one you see.
In order to not have to reinstall all your plugins everytime you upgrade, I recommend you the creation of a product extension where you store all the plugins you don't regularly update (http://help.eclipse.org/help31/index.jsp?topic=/org.eclipse.platform.doc.isv/guide/product_extension.htm)
*** Bug 157037 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
